seriesJson.title: The American cowboy
seriesJson.description: Documentary series on the American cowboy, produced by the University of Texas.

node.title: The cowboy's likeness
node.description: This program focuses on the challenge that artists face when trying to capture the essence of the cowboy in their art.

node.title: Pilots of plain and pass
node.description: This program focuses on distinct elements of cowboy culture and how they often each had their own discrete times and contexts.

node.title: Tongue loose and fancy free
node.description: This program focuses on the role of the raconteur in cowboy culture.

node.title: Petticoats on the plain
node.description: This program focuses on some women's experiences in the cowboy's world.

node.title: Laughter, loud and lonely
node.description: This program focuses on the "jovial joys" of the cowboy.

node.title: Get up, guns, and gear
node.description: This program focuses on the typical accoutrements of the cowboy.

node.title: The cowboy comes to town
node.description: This program focuses on the cowboy's preferred recreational activities.

node.title: Half horse, half human
node.description: This program focuses on the importance of the horse in the life of a cowboy.

node.title: Ranch and range
node.description: This program focuses on typical cowboy settlements.

node.title: Cowboy on the trail
node.description: This program focuses on stories of cowboys on the trail.

node.title: Suited to his time
node.description: This program offers an introduction to the American cowboy.

node.title: Fiction, fancy, and fact
node.description: This program looks at the various elements - some based in reality, others not - that created the cowboy mystique.

node.title: Promo collection
node.description: This program consists of promotional announcements for the series.
